The coin loan interest is {{0}} per day, calculated from the time of application with an hour as the minimal unit of calculation. Loan repaid within one hour will be charged the interest of one hour. When making repayment, you need to repay both the loan and the interest. If HT or point card is enabled to deduct coin interest, the system will automatically deduct when it detects that HT or point card is available. If the balance is insufficient, the interest will be calculated in the related currency and the interest will be deducted when the loan is returned.

The margin loan interest rate is {{0}} per day, calculated from the time of application with an hour as the minimal calculation interval. If a loan is repaid within one hour, interest charged will be calculated based on the one-hour duration. When making repayments, you need to repay both loans and interest. If a crypto or point card is enabled to deduct interest, the automatic deduction will be conducted when the system detects that the balance of the crypto or point card is available. If the balance is insufficient, interest will be calculated and repaid in the trading currency.

In line with the laws and regulations of the US with respect to crypto assets, our User Agreement expressly prohibits users in the US from using our platform. For that reason, the accounts of US users have been gradually disabled, to prevent any further trading or transferring. Asset withdrawing will remain permitted until 12/31/2019. From now on, our mobile App will be ceased to provide services to US users. You can withdraw your asset by using the WEB or PC interface of Huobi Global. We are sorry for any inconvenience resulting therefrom.

How to calculate the daily PnL?\10(Assets at 16:00 UTC today or earlier) - (Assets at 16:00 yesterday) - (Assets transferred in from 16:00 yesterday to 16:00 today) + (Assets transferred out from 16:00 yesterday to 16:00 today)
MA (or moving average) is a technical indicator formed by linking the arithmetic average of closing prices over a period. It can be used to reflect the trend of stock price.

Also known as Bollinger bands, BOLL is basically a banded channel consisting of three bands (one in the middle, one placed above and one placed below). The middle band is the average cost of the price, and the upper and lower band can be regarded as the resistence and support band respectively.
EMA, short for exponential moving average, is an weighted arithmetic average of the closing prices. It is used to indicate potential price trends.
1. MA (or moving average) is a technical indicator formed by linking the arithmetic average of closing prices over a period. It can be used to reflect the trend of stock price.

KDJ calculates the immature random value of the last calculation period with the highest price & the lowest price in a certain period (usually 9 days, 9 weeks, etc.), the closing price of the last calculation period, and the ratio between these three figures. Then it calculates K, D and J value according to EXPMA, and develops a curve for prediction of the price trend.
MA is formed by linking the arithmetic average of closing prices over a period. It can smooth short-term fluctuations and reflect long-term trends or cycles.

MACD consists of a set of curves and graphs. It\'s the difference between a fast and a slow exponential moving average (EMA) of the closing price. \"S\" refers to shorter-period EMA and \"L\" refers to longer-period EMA. The most commonly used values are 12-day and 26-day EMA.
RSI is a technical analysis tool that moves up and down to respond to market change rates. The 14-day RSI is the most effective one.

WR is a type of momentum indicator that moves between 0 and -100 and indicates overbought and oversold levels. It measures the rate of price spread of peak value (highest price) created by the long interest and short interest and the daily closing price, and the price fluctuation range over a certain period of time (such as 7 days, 14 days, 28 days, etc.), in order to reflect signals of price trend.

This Margin Trading Service Agreement (“this Agreement”) is an agreement entered into by and between this Website (also known as \"the Platform\") and the User (\"You\") regarding Your use of the virtual assets Margin Loan and margin trading services provided by this Website (hereinafter referred to as \"the Services\"). By visiting and logging into this Website (including the API, applications and other terminals thereof), using any service provided by this Website, or clicking on the \"Read and Agree\" button, You confirm that You have read, understood and accepted all the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement, as well as all the terms and conditions set forth in the User Agreement. If You do not agree to any term or condition of this Agreement or the User Agreement, please stop visiting this Website and stop using the Services. If You continue visiting this Website or using the Services, You will be deemed to have unconditionally agreed to the entire content of this Agreement and the User Agreement. This Agreement is made in Chinese. For the convenience of the Users, this Agreement may be translated into different languages. All language versions of this Agreement, except for the Chinese version hereof, are for reference only. Should there be any inconsistency between different language versions hereof, the Chinese version hereof shall always prevail.

(5)Market Risks. This Website does not warrant the correctness or applicability of any relevant market analyses, market evaluation and other content on this Website or elsewhere. This Website cannot control, support or guarantee the accuracy or completeness of the information or suggestions that You have obtained or will obtain from your agent or any other organization or employee thereof. You must be solely responsible for any and all risks or consequences arising therefrom, and this Website shall not be held liable in any manner whatsoever.

(6)Risks of Seizure and Freezing. When a competent authority, by presenting the requisite warrant for an investigation, requires this Website to assist with the investigation into Your account with this Website, Your assets or Your transaction data on the Website, or adopt such measures against Your account as sealing up, freezing or transfers, this Website shall provide such assistance by providing Your relevant data or carrying out corresponding operations in accordance with the requirements of the competent authority, and in this case, this Website shall not bear the responsibility for privacy disclosure, account access interruption, and even losses caused thereby.

(7)Other Risks: You shall bear any and all losses arising in any of the following situations: (a) losses you sustain due to such factors as lost account ID, forgotten password, improper operation, and investment decision-making mistakes; (b) losses caused by any malicious operation of Your account by any third party because you engage in online entrustment or You fail to log out after hot-key operation through Your account; (c) losses caused by You entrusting any other person to carry out margin trading on this Website on Your behalf; (d) Losses caused by any other accident and factors not attributable to this Website.

Special Reminder: When You engage in Margin Loan and margin trading on this Website, You should manage the potential risks thereof on your own, assess the value and risks of investment in virtual assets, and bear the possible financial risks of losing all Your investments. You should take into consideration of Your financial conditions and risk tolerance capacity before conducting any margin trading, and recognize the risks of crypto investment. You may make profits or sustain losses when engaging in margin trading in virtual assets. The Risk Reminder in this Agreement does not list all risks involved in the margin trading of virtual assets. You are hereby advised to have a clear understanding of this, and please be reminded that the investment market may involve high risks and prudent investment is recommended.

5. Definitions. In this Agreement, the following terms shall have the following meanings:\10(1)Margin Trading: refers to virtual assets transactions conducted by using borrowed crypto assets of Margin Loan on this Website.\10(2) Margin Trading Account: refers to a virtual sub-account set up under the User\'s existing UID account for deposit and borrowed crypto assets of Margin Loan. The accounting of assets under the Margin Trading Account is separate from that of other sub-accounts under the User\'s UID account.\10(3)Margin Loan: refers to borrowing of virtual assets from this Website to conduct Margin Trading.\10(4)Secured asset: refers to a certain amount of virtual assets that must be deposited to the designated Margin Trading Account in advance as collateral for Margin Loans.\10(5) Risk Ratio: refers to the risk ratio of a Margin Trading Account, that is, the risk ratio calculated based on the amount of Margin Loans in each Margin Trading Account and the total value of assets in the same account.\10(6) Forced Liquidation: refers to the action or actions that this Website is entitled to take to dispose of all assets in a Margin Trading Account to recover the Margin Loan and corresponding interest when and if the risk ratio of such Margin Trading Account reaches a certain standard, also known as \"FL\".

6.Types of Services. The margin trading services provided by this Website are divided into two types: Isolated Margin Trading and Cross Margin Trading. Different types of margin trading are subject to different operating rules. Users should carefully read and agree to abide by the corresponding operating rules when they use a specific type of margin trading service.

7.Qualifications. When using the Services hereunder, You must have completed the account registration and authentication in accordance with the terms and conditions of the User Agreement, and legally hold a valid UID account and login password.

8.Set-up of a Margin Trading Account. When a User applies for a Margin Loan with certain crypto asset for the first time, this Website will automatically set up a margin trading account for the User, which shall be exclusively used for storing and accounting of crypto assets related to the such Margin Loan. The applicable type of cryptocurrencies is determined in accordance with the type of margin trading selected by You and the corresponding operating rules. The account number or login password of Your margin trading account is the same as Your UID account number and login password of the User, and You can operate Your margin trading account after logging into Your UID account.

9.Transfer of secured asset. Before applying for any Margin Loan, you must deposit the required secured asset to the designated margin trading account. The type of crypto assets permitted for using as margin and for Margin Loan will be determined by this Website in accordance with the type of the margin trading selected by You and the corresponding operating rules thereof.
10.Application for Coin Loan. After the required margin is received, You may apply for a Margin Loan subject to the maximum Margin Loan allowed on this Website.

1.Scope and Application of this Agreement. This Agreement shall apply to Your use of this Website for margin trading. This Agreement includes the operating rules formulated by this Website for different types of margin trading services, as well as the additional clauses such as amendments to this Agreement and the operating rules from time to time by this Website in the form of announcements, including but not limited to Cross Margin Trading Rules, Isolated Margin Trading Rules, and any and all announcements regarding leverage multiples, rates, margins, risk ratio, forced liquidation, etc. This Agreement is a supplementary agreement to the User Agreement. In case of any inconsistency between this Agreement and the User Agreement, this Agreement shall prevail. With regard to any matter for which there is no specific provision herein, the User Agreement shall prevail in connection with such matter.

11.Expenses. You acknowledge and agree that the loan interest, handling fee and other related expenses may be incurred when using the Services, and You agree to pay such interests, fees or expenses in accordance with this Agreement. Margin Loan interest is calculated on an hourly basis starting from the time when You receive the Margin Loan, and for the time that is less than one hour, it will be deemed as an hour. The hourly interest rates and payment method for Margin Loans shall be subject to the corresponding operating rules. The rate of handling fees and payment method shall be subject to the User Agreement and relevant rules and announcements of the Platform for the transaction handling fees.

12. Loan Repayment. You shall timely return the borrowed crypto assets of any and all Margin Loans in accordance with this Agreement. Each application and loan repayment shall be handled on a case-by-case basis, and any repayment to the Website will be deemed as payment of the loan interest first, and then the principal of the Margin Loan.
13.For the sake of funds security, You acknowledge and agree that this Website has the right to restrict any transfer out of Your margin trading account when You have any outstanding coin loan.

14. Liquidation. When the total assets in your margin trading account with this Website are less than 110% of the aggregate amount of all outstanding Margin Loans for the same account, this Website will have the right to either buy with or sell all the assets in such account to repay the outstanding Margin Loans at the real-time order price of this Website. If, because price fluctuates violently, the system may not be able to close the position, or to recover all the outstanding Margin Loans and related interests after closing the position, or this Website may sustain other losses, this Website shall have the right to recourse for repayment or compensation from You, and at any subsequent time when You transfer digital assets to the margin trading account, this Website shall have the right to dispose of such crypto assets to recover such outstanding Margin Loans and related coin interests or compensation for other losses.

15.When using the Services, You shall abide by all applicable laws and regulations, follow operating rules related to each margin trading, and comply with the provisions of this Agreement and the User Agreement.
16.This Website reserves the right to unilaterally suspend or terminate the provision of Margin Loan and related services at any time if necessary for risk control purposes.

2.Modification. This Website reserves the right to decide, at its sole discretion, to modify or amend this Agreement from time to time and at any time. Any and all modifications or amendment to this Agreement will take effect upon being published on this Website or otherwise delivered to the Users. Therefore, by continuing to use the services of this Website, You shall be deemed to have accepted the modified or amended agreement and rules hereunder. If You do not agree to any modification or amendment made to this Agreement, You shall cease Your use of the Services hereunder immediately. It is Your responsibility to review this Agreement frequently to ensure that You understand the terms and conditions applicable to Your access to and use of the Services.

3.Voluntary Conduct. You acknowledge that Your conduct of margin trading on this Website is entirely a voluntary conduct of Yours based on Your own economic situation and Your knowledge of the relevant risks You face, which is not related to this Website and the third party in any manner whatsoever.

4.Risk Reminder. When You engage in margin trading on this Website, You may get relatively high returns; however, You may also be subject to significant risks. In order to help You better understand the potential risks and, in accordance with relevant laws, regulations, administrative rules and relevant state policies, we hereby advise You of the risks that may be involved in margin trading, which we encourage you to read carefully, which include but are not limited to-:

(1) Virtual assets-related risks: the virtual assets market is a brand new and unverified market that may or may not grow. At present, cryptocurrencies are mostly used by speculators, and less used in retailing and commercial markets; therefore, the price of cryptocurrencies is volatile and prone to fluctuations, which may further adversely affect the investment in virtual assets. Unlike the stock market, the virtual assets market does not have any limit up and down, and trading on the crypto market is open 24 hours a day. The price of virtual assets may fluctuate greatly because: (i) the number of chips is relatively small; (ii) the market prices are vulnerable to control by the market makers; and (iii) the influence of regulatory policies of countries concerned, among others. The price may rise several times or fall by half in a single day. Therefore, You must understand and agree that You will be solely responsible for any and all the economic losses caused to You due to virtual assets themselves.

(2)Policy Risks: virtual assets transactions may be suspended or prohibited at any time due to the formulation or modification of applicable laws, rules and regulations for digital assets in various jurisdictions. You must understand and agree that due to the formulation or modification of applicable laws, regulations and regulatory documents, the transaction of virtual assets may be suspended or prohibited, and any and all economic losses as a result therefrom shall be borne by You.

(3)Internet and Technical Risks: this Website cannot and will not warrant the absolute security of information, programs, texts and other information contained in this Website, or warrant that they are free from interference and damage by any malicious programs, such as computer viruses and Trojans. Therefore, You shall be solely responsible for any risks and losses arising out of or in connection with Your logging in and using any service of this Website, using this Website to download any program, information and data, or using such downloaded program, information and data. At the same time, the use of Internet-based trading systems also involves risks, including but not limited to the failure of software, hardware and Internet connection. As this Website cannot control the reliability and availability of the Internet, this Website shall not be held liable in any manner whatsoever for any distortion, delay and connection failure. At the same time, the Users should bear the risks and losses arising out of the closing out of any margin trading account due to server gateway bottleneck, or unstable website access, among others.

(4)Force Majeure: this Website shall not be held liable in any manner for any inability to provide the Services or any delay in providing such Services, or any and all loss and damages You may sustain therefrom, which are caused by any of the following factors: maintenance of information network equipment, failure of information network connection, malfunction of computers, communication system or other systems, power failure, exposure to hacker attacks, weather, accidents, industrial actions, labor disputes, riots, uprisings, riots, insufficient productivity or means of production, fires, floods, storms, explosions, wars, bank or other partners, collapse of the virtual assets market, government behaviors, judicial or administrative orders or any other conducts that are beyond the control of this Website or any factor on the part of any third party.

HTX 10 Index is composed of 10 tokens that are listed on HTX and have the higher market value, larger scale and better circulation to reflect the overall performance of HTX\'s market. \10The sample space is all listed tokens that are traded against USDT at HTX. According to the different properties of the blockchain assets, they can be divided into four categories: \"token\", \"platform\", \"application\" and \"real asset token\". \10The \"token\" refers to an asset developed on the basis of blockchain technology that does not correspond to a specific use case and whose main function is only the subject of the transaction, the value of which is mainly reflected through liquidity; \10The “platform” token refers to the asset associated with development of the underlying blockchain technology and supported by the right to use or to participate in the platform; \10The “application” token refers to the asset associated with a specific application scenario and supported by a certain right to use, participation or dividend; \10The “real asset token” refers to digital currencies that are linked with gold, US dollar and other actual assets. \10On this basis, HTX 10 Index is calculated by the formula of Pasche weighted composite price index, with the average daily trading volume of the previous quarter taken as a core index of sample selection. \10The daily average data can reduce the impact of single-day price volatility and better reflect the liquidity of digital assets during the audit period. In addition, this index will determine the proportion of index components of different types of blockchain assets according to the sum of the average daily trading volume of each type of blockchain assets in the previous quarter, so as to comprehensively reflect the overall performance of blockchain assets listed on HTX and reflect the overall development of all kinds of blockchain technology applications.

MV|Qty: Market value and token quantity of deposits in HTX Earn.\10Yesterday\'s Interests: The interests earned in Auto-Invest in the previous day.\10Cumulative Interests: The accrued interests of a token since it\'s transferred in Auto-Invest. Trailing Stop Order is a type of strategy order that enables traders to preset orders to enter the market when they expect the market to revert. \10\101) Trailing-Stop Buy order: when the last price drops to the set activation price, the trailing stop order will be activated. Then the market price will continue to be tracked to determine the lows and pullups. When the price pullup reaches the preset pullup rate (callback rate), a limit order based on your preset buy price and the amount will be sent to the market to help you buy the dips automatically without having to resort to human efforts;\10\102) Trailing-Stop Sell order: when the last price rises to the set activation price, the trailing stop order will be activated. Then the market price will continue to be tracked to determine the highs and pullbacks. When the price pullback reaches the preset pullback rate (callback rate), a limit order based on your preset sell price and the amount will be sent to the market to help you sell the highs automatically without having to resort to human efforts;\10\103) Formula price: the high and low prices before the market pulls back or pulls up to your preset callback rate;\10\104) After the order is activated, the system will continue to track and analyze the high and low points. The orders will only be triggered if the pullups or pullbacks reach your preset callback rate. You can cancel the order before it is triggered; \10\105) When the price movements finally meet your triggering conditions, a limit order will be sent to the market based on your preset limit price and amount.

Limit Order requires users to enter the order size and their acceptable highest buy price or lowest sell price. A limit order, once placed, will be matched based on the price-time priority rule. In the cases when the set buy price is higher than or the sell price is lower than the market price, the market will match the limit orders by prioritizing the most favorable price. Limit orders can be used to open and close positions.\10\10Please note limit orders will freeze positions/margins in advance.\10\10There have three advanced modes for limit order: \10\10>1) Post Only: the order type is not to be immediately filled so that the user posting the order remains as a Maker only. The order will be canceled if it can be immediately filled in the market. \10\10>2) FOK: when the set price is reached, the order has to be executed wholly; otherwise, the order will be canceled in full. \10\10>3) IOC: when the set price is reached, the order has to be executed immediately and as fully as possible. The unfilled portion will be canceled immediately.

When the current price (A) falls to the order\'s limit buy price (C) or below, the order will be executed automatically. If the order\'s buy price is higher than the current price, the buy order may be filled immediately. Therefore, when setting a limit buy order, set the limit buy price lower than the current price. \10\10For instance: \10\10>1) As shown in the chart above, you have set a limit buy order with a limit price of 1,500 (C) while the current price is 2,400 (A), the order will not be executed until the price falls to or below %s; \10\10>2) Conversely, if you set the limit buy price at %s, higher than the current price, the order may be executed immediately. However, the current market price implies that the best price for a buy order should be around 2,400, instead of a much higher 3,000.

When the current price (A) rises to the order\'s limit sell price (C) or above, the order will be executed automatically. If the order\'s sell price is no higher than the current price, the sell order may be filled immediately. Therefore, when setting a limit sell order, set the limit sell price higher than the current price. \10\10For instance: \10\10>1) As shown in the chart above, you have set a limit sell order with a limit price of 3,000 (C) while the current price is 2,400 (A), the order will not be executed until the price rises to or above %s; \10\10>2) Conversely, if you set the limit sell price at %s, lower than the current price, the order may be executed immediately. However, the current market price implies that the best price for a sell order should be around 2,400, instead of a much lower 1,500.
Market orders are effectively executed at the best available prices in the market. The volume filled and the execution prices depend on the market conditions.

You placed a market order when the current price was 2,400. This market order may be directly filled based on the %s, but the average execution price is probably not 2,400. Instead, it can be either higher or lower than 2,400 depending on the side of the order and the market conditions. \10\10Tips: For market buy orders, the average execution price is usually slightly higher than the current price; For market sell orders, the average execution price is usually slightly lower than the current price.

Trigger Order is a type of strategy order where users can enter the trigger price, buy/sell price, and amount. When the market price reaches the trigger price, the order will be placed as per preset. This type of order will not freeze positions/margins in advance.\10\10Trigger price: when the last price reaches the set trigger price, the order will be triggered and sent to the market; \10\10Limit buy/sell price: after the order has been triggered and sent to the market, it waits to be filled at the preset limit prices; \10\10 Amount: refers to the order size entering the market after the order is triggered.

TWAP (time-weighted average price) is a trading strategy that breaks down a large order into many smaller chunks which are sent to the market at the preset time intervals. \10\10By splitting a large order into fragmented ones, market impact is reduced. In a TWAP strategy, the split chunk orders are sent to the market at bid/offer prices that equal the Buy1/Sell1 plus/minus a price spread.\10\10(The orders are sent in IOC mode for immediate execution and cancellation of the unfilled part)\10\10Price distance: Refers to the distance (specified by a spread or spread ratio) between the bid/offer price and the market price. Assuming a TWAP buy strategy, split orders will be sent to the market at the bid price, which is higher than the Buy1 price by the spread/spread ratio.\10\10Limit Price: Refers to the limit price for the TWAP strategy. In a TWAP buy strategy, the split orders are sent to the market at the bid price (Buy1 + Spread), which has to be lower than the limit price for the order to be filled.\10\10Chunk Size: Refers to the size of each small order after splitting the Total Size of the TWAP order. In a TWAP strategy, the split orders, each of the chunk size, will be sent to the market at the bid/offer price that is higher/lower than the Best 1 price by the spread/spread ratio.\10\10Total Size: Refers to the total size of your TWAP order. The chunk orders will be sent to the market at the bid/offer price until the entire TWAP order is completed.\10\10Time Interval: Refers to the time interval between every two split orders placed. In a TWAP strategy, the split orders (chunks) are sent to the market at the bid/offer price (Best1 + spread) one after one at regular intervals.

TP/SL is a trading strategy that allows users to preset trigger prices (take-profit price/stop-loss price), buy/sell prices, and amount. When the last price reaches the trigger conditions, orders will be sent to the market at the preset size and prices to close the position and take profit, or stop loss. Take-profit/stop-loss conditions can be set when you want to open or close a position. An amount of margin will be required and frozen if you open a position with take-profit/stop-loss conditions; \10\10The corresponding position size will be frozen if you set take-profit/stop-loss conditions for an existing position; \10\10Trigger price: when the last price reaches the set trigger price, the order will be triggered and sent to the market; \10\10Limit buy/sell price: after the order has been triggered and sent to the market, it waits to be filled at the preset limit prices.
An IOC order is an order to execute all or part immediately and cancel any unfilled portion of the order.

An isolated amount of margin asset is allocated to one position. If the position margin falls below the maintenance margin, the position will be liquidated. You can add or reduce the margin to a position under isolated margin mode.

Leverage Available for Position Limit Increase
1. A position limit increase is only open for USDT-margined perpetual futures.
2. The applicable trading pairs and specific position limits after adjustments are designated by the platform based on historical data.

3. After an increase, the new position limit is a predetermined multiple of the maximum position limit under the current leverage, which is subject to periodic adjustments. For example, if the current basic position limit for BTCUSDT at 100x leverage is 250,000 USDT, and the multiplier is 6, the position limit at 100x leverage after the increase will be 1.5 million USDT.

4. You can apply for an increase in the position limit for a trading pair when the three requirements are met: Your assets in your USDT-margined Futures account exceed %s USDT; You have positions of this trading pair; The trading pair is applicable for a position limit increase.
5. If no trades are made in USDT-margined perpetual futures within 30 days of a position limit increase, your boosted limit will revert to the basic position limit automatically.

Interest refers to the yield users receive immediately after subscribing, and they are determined by factors such as the subscription amount, expiration date, target price, redemption price, and the current price of the underlying asset. In general, the higher the likelihood of the product being exercised on the expiration date, the greater the interest earned from the product. To maximize your interest, consider these strategies: opt for larger subscription amounts, set a target price closer to the current price of the underlying asset, hold the product for a longer duration, and leave the redemption price unspecified or set it further from the target price.

Assume you spend 80,000 USDT to subscribe to a 30-day Buy BTC Low with USDT product, with a target price of 40,000 and a redemption price of 35,000. After the subscription, you will immediately receive 2,000 USDT as interest earned from this product. When the product matures in 30 days, you will face the following three scenarios:
The product is not exercised, and you will receive your principal of 80,000 USDT. To sum up, you will score 82,000 USDT from this product.
The protection mechanism of redemption is in effect. The product is not exercised, and you will receive your principal of 80,000 USDT. In general, you will pocket 82,000 USDT from this product.
The product is exercised, and you will receive a return of 2 BTC (80,000 / 40,000). To sum up, you will score 2,000 USDT and 2 BTC from this product.

Assume you spend 1 BTC to subscribe to a 30-day Sell BTC High for USDT product, with a target price of 42,000 and a redemption price of 48,000. After the subscription, you will immediately receive 2,000 USDT as interest earned from this product. When the product matures in 30 days, you will face the following three scenarios:
In this case, the product is not exercised, and you will receive your principal of 1 BTC. Overall, you will get 2,000 USDT and 1 BTC from this product.
The protection mechanism of redemption is in effect. The product is not exercised, and you will receive your principal of 1 BTC. In general, you will pocket 2,000 USDT and 1 BTC from this product.
The product is exercised, and you will receive a return of 42,000 USDT (1 x 42,000). To sum up, you will score 44,000 USDT from this product.

What are the advantages of HTX\'s Dual Investment?

If your Buy Low or Sell High order is not executed at expiration, your principal will be automatically reinvested in new orders.\101. The Auto Reinvest status can be modified before %s.\102. New orders created after reinvestment will have Auto Reinvest enabled by default. You can manually disable it.\103. Reinvested orders will not have a redemption price, whether the current order has a redemption price set or not.\104. Successful reinvestment cannot be guaranteed due to market volatility, quote fluctuations, remaining balance, and other factors at order expiration.

Dual Investment offers two types of products: Buy Low and Sell High
Buy Low (e.g. buy BTC low with USDT)

If the product is exercised, you will receive a return in BTC, i.e. Return amount = Subscription amount / Target price. If the product is not exercised, you will receive your principal in USDT, the same amount of your subscription.

After subscribing to the product with USDT, you will immediately receive USDT as interest. On the product\'s expiration date, you will receive either the full amount of your principal in USDT or a return in BTC at the target price, depending on whether the product is exercised.
If the settlement price is > the target price, the product will be not exercised.
If the settlement price is %s the target price, the product will be exercised.
If the settlement price is ≤ the redemption price, the product will be not exercised.
If the target price is ≥ settlement price > the redemption price, the product will be exercised.
Sell High (e.g. sell BTC high for USDT)

If the product is exercised, you will receive a return in USDT, i.e. Return amount = Subscription amount x Target price. If the product is not exercised, you will receive your principal in BTC, the same amount of your subscription.

After subscribing to the product with BTC, you will immediately receive USDT as interest. On the product\'s expiration date, you will receive either the full amount of your principal in BTC or a return in USDT at the target price, depending on whether the product is exercised.
1. No redemption price is set at the time of subscription. Upon maturity:
If the settlement price is ≥ the target price, the product will be exercised.
If the settlement price is < the target price, the product will be not exercised.
2. A redemption price has been set. Upon maturity:
If the settlement price is ≥ the redemption price, the product will be not exercised.
If the redemption price is > settlement price ≥ the target price, the product will be exercised.

Which terms do I need to know?
Settlement Price: The average price of the underlying asset from 07:30 to 08:00 (UTC) on the expiration date.
Settlement Price: The index price of the underlying asset on HTX Futures at 08:00 (UTC) on the expiration date.
Est. Interest: The yield received immediately after subscribing to a product. To obtain the most accurate figures, please refer to the actual interest after a successful subscription.
Term rate: The absolute return rate of a product derived from its APY. Formula: Term rate = APY × (Number of subscription days / 365).
Underlying Asset: The asset specified in a Dual Investment product. For example, if settlement and target prices are based on BTC, the underlying asset is BTC.

Redemption Price: The protective price in extreme market conditions, resulting in the product not being exercised if, at maturity, the underlying asset\'s price at maturity ≥ the redemption price (selling high) or the underlying asset\'s price ≤ the redemption price (buying low).
Target Price: The price at which you aim to sell high or buy low. If the product is exercised, your principal cryptocurrency will be converted into another cryptocurrency at the set price.
Term: Number of days from the subscription date to the expiration date.
Subscription Amount: Quantity of the cryptocurrencies you invest when subscribing to a product.
No quote. Modify the target price.

The redemption price serves as a safeguard mechanism for extreme market conditions. Setting a redemption price ensures that your Dual Investment order will not be executed at excessively high or low prices when the price fluctuates significantly (resulting in the return of your principal only). This helps you avoid missing out on better selling or buying opportunities.

The redemption price acts as a safeguard against extreme market conditions. Setting a redemption price can ensure that your subscription does not execute amid periods of high market volatility. Only your principal will return when the redemption triggers. This allows you to seize better opportunities to buy low and sell high.\10Example:\101. Selling BTC High: Assume you invest 1 BTC in a product with the aim to sell BTC at the price of 50,000 USDT. Without a redemption price set, if the BTC price reaches ≥ 50,000 USDT at maturity, the subscription will be executed, and you will receive 1 x 50,000 = 50,000 USDT. However, if you set a redemption price of 55,000 USDT and the BTC price hits ≥ 55,000 USDT at maturity, despite surpassing the target price of 50,000 USDT, the subscription will not be executed due to the protective redemption price you\'ve set. In this scenario, you will receive your principal of 1 BTC.\102. Buying BTC Low: Assume you invest 80,000 USDT in a product with the goal to buy BTC at the price of 40,000 USDT. Without a redemption price set, if the BTC price reaches ≤ 40,000 USDT at maturity, the subscription will be executed, and you will receive 80,000 / 40,000 = 2 BTC. Conversely, if you set a redemption price of 35,000 USDT and the BTC price hits ≤ 35,000 USDT at maturity, despite the price being lower than the target price of 40,000 USDT, the subscription will not be executed due to the redemption price you\'ve set. In this case, you will receive your principal of 80,000 USDT.

The redemption price acts as a safeguard against extreme market conditions. Setting a redemption price can ensure that your subscription does not execute amid periods of high market volatility. Selling BTC High: Assume you invest 1 BTC in a product with the aim to sell BTC at the price of 50,000 USDT. Without a redemption price set, if the BTC price reaches ≥ 50,000 USDT at maturity, the subscription will be executed, and you will receive 1 x 50,000 = 50,000 USDT. However, if you set a redemption price of 55,000 USDT and the BTC price hits ≥ 55,000 USDT at maturity, despite surpassing the target price of 50,000 USDT, the subscription will not be executed due to the protective redemption price you\'ve set. In this scenario, you will receive your principal of 1 BTC. \102. Buying BTC Low: Assume you invest 80,000 USDT in a product with the goal to buy BTC at the price of 40,000 USDT. Without a redemption price set, if the BTC price reaches ≤ 40,000 USDT at maturity, the subscription will be executed, and you will receive 80,000 / 40,000 = 2 BTC. Conversely, if you set a redemption price of 35,000 USDT and the BTC price hits ≤ 35,000 USDT at maturity, despite the price being lower than the target price of 40,000 USDT, the subscription will not be executed due to the redemption price you\'ve set. In this case, you will receive your principal of 80,000 USDT.

This Leveraged Trading Service Agreement (“this Agreement”) is an agreement between this Website (or “the Platform”) and the User (“You”) regarding your use of the leveraged digital assets loan and leveraged trading service (“the Service”) provided by this Website.
